title: Bugbear
entryLore: Bugbears are the hulking cousins of goblins and hobgoblins. Rooted in the Feywild, they possess a mystical ability to hide in shadowed spaces and move with surprising silence despite their formidable build. They are often quiet skulkers, driven by a fey gift for lurking and a predatory patience that makes them lethal ambushers.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.description: You have [[advantage|Advantage]] on [[saving_throw|saving throws]] you make to avoid or end the [[charmed_condition|Charmed]] condition.

traits.name: Long-Limbed
traits.description: When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.

traits.name: Powerful Build
traits.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

traits.name: Sneaky
traits.description: You are [[proficiency|proficient]] in the [[stealth|Stealth]] skill. In addition, without squeezing, you can move through and stop in a space large enough for a Small creature.

traits.name: Surprise Attack
traits.description: If you hit a creature with an attack roll, the creature takes an extra 2d6 damage if it hasn't taken a turn in the current combat yet.
